(3) It shall be the duty of a labour tribunal not to permit  any extension of the periods referred to in subsection (1) and  (2), except for exceptional reasons to be recorded by the  tribunal. .

(4) On receipt of the statement transmitted by the  applicant under subsection (2), it shall be the duty of the labour  tribunal to forthwith and in any event not later than three  working days after such date of receipt, to fix the application  for hearing and by a notice, inform all parties to the application  of such date.

(5) Where the employer or the applicant as the case may  be, fails to transmit the statement required under subsection  (1) or (2), it shall be the duty of the labour tribunal to forthwith  and in any event not Jater than three working days after the  date of such default, to fix the application for hearing and  inform by noticé all parties to the application of such date.
